fields.description:
The [New Directory Type, that allows local groups in a Crowd LDAP Connector|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1284] will provide an alternative for customers that were depending on the Directories data Amalgamation/Aggregation. However, a feature that migrates from the old Directories into the [New Directory|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1284] is still necessary. 

It is expected that the feature will replicate groups and memberships from all Directory types to all Directory types.
fields.summary: Create Migration Feature From Old Amalgamated Data into New Directory with Local Groups

fields.description:
I'm maybe not that smart on this, I have had a lot of troubles on Stage 2, Step 4 11. & 12.
I could not find osuser.xml nor had seraph-config.xml the entries I was looking for.
I deinstalled 4.3, installed latest 4.2 enterprise edition, made the suggestested changes, was very careful while upgrading to 4.3 and succeeded. But this is a fight that maybe wasnt necessary?

Anyway, love atlassian tools :-)
fields.summary: Dragon Slayers experience: Stage 2 is out of date for integration of JIRA 4.3

fields.description:
Currently Crowd supports the following restrictions:
{code}
EXACTLY_MATCHES
STARTS_WITH
CONTAINS
LESS_THAN
GREATER_THAN
NULL
{code}
fields.summary: Support ENDS_WITH in the Abstraction Query Layer, CQL and REST APIs

fields.description:
The change was done [here|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/browse/crowd/trunk/components/crowd-server/src/main/resources/applicationContext-CrowdPlugins.xml?r2=132944&r1=115229].

E.g. we have already a dependency on org.dom4j.io.SAXReader
fields.summary: Sub-packages of dom4j are not exported to the OSGi container

fields.description:
The Crowd-Bamboo authenticator needs updating for Bamboo 3.0+.

{quote}
[09:19] <jimmyz2_> figured out my issue:
[09:20] <jimmyz2_> http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Dragons+Stage+8+-+Install+Bamboo#DragonsStage8-InstallBamboo-Step4.HookBamboouptoCrowd
[09:20] <jimmyz2_> step 12 should have read:
[09:20] <jimmyz2_> <authenticator class="com.atlassian.crowd.integration.seraph.v22.BambooAuthenticator"/>
[09:20] <jimmyz2_> not:
[09:20] <jimmyz2_> <authenticator class="com.atlassian.crowd.integration.seraph.BambooAuthenticator"/>
[09:20] <jimmyz2_> once i fixed that, all was good.
{quote}
fields.summary: Possible update required to crowd dragon docs

fields.description: The RemoteDirectorySynchronisedEvent is fired too early. Currently it is fired in com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher#synchroniseAll (or com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher#synchroniseChanges), before the directory attribute IS_SYNCHRONISING is reset (in com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserHelperImpl#updateSyncEndTime), making it impossible to reliably wait until the synchronisation job completes. It needs to be fired after this attribute is updated instead.
fields.summary: RemoteDirectorySynchronisedEvent fired too early

fields.description:
# When the caching algorithm synchronises user memberships for a group, it performs it twice for each group.
# Group memberships are synchronised even when nested groups are disabled.
# Remote Crowd Directory tries to synchronise roles, but as roles are not supported by the REST api, ends up syncing memberships twice.
fields.summary: Memberships are synchronised multiple times for LDAP (excluding Active Directory) and Crowd directories
creating a group in OpenLDAP through Confluence with Crowd integration does not work - fix described

fields.description:
The example code snippets (<http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWDDEV/Creating+a+Custom+Directory+Connector>) for creating a custom directory connector is out of date. Several classes which should be imported cannot be found, such as the following:
{code}
com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemoteGroup
com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemotePrincipal
com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemoteRole
{code}
It would be great if the documentation is updated to increase the utility for user connector developments.
fields.summary: Documentation for Creating a Custom Directory Connector is not updated

fields.description: Create a functional test in JIRA to ensure that filtered groups are not exposed in any JIRA screens.
fields.summary: Functional tests for the FilteringCrowdService in JIRA

fields.description:
For Studio Rise of the Machines, we require a version of CrowdService that is able to filter out certain groups.  This CrowdService should accept a list of groups to filter out in search, findByName and other operations.

The following are the guidelines about how to handle filtered groups.

{{addGroup}} will throw an OperationFailedException (runtime exception version).
All other operations will behave as though the group does not exist: {{getGroup}}, {{getGroupWithAttributes}}, {{search}}, {{isUserMemberOfGroup}}, {{isGroupMemberOfGroup}}, {{updateGroup}}, {{addUserToGroup}}, {{addGroupToGroup}}, {{setGroupAttribute}}, {{removeGroupAttributes}}, {{removeAllGroupAttributes}}, {{removeGroup}}, {{removeUserFromGroup}}, {{removeGroupFromGroup}}, {{isUserDirectGroupMember}}, {{isGroupDirectGroupMember}}
fields.summary: Create a version of CrowdService that performs filtering

fields.description: Rest resource provided by Sync feedback plugin should forbid caching.
fields.summary: Sync status is not automatically updated in Internet Explorer (caching issue)

fields.description:
Two options:-
1. Find a firefox extension to alternate the screen. 
2. Use confluence's wall board. https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/private/atlassian/confluence/tools/wallboard/trunk  . See the sample one here http://tooheys:8080/bamboo-wallboard   .

The page to be included here https://bamboo-extranet.atlassian.com/build/generateLoadTestReport.action?buildKey=CWD-TPMLOAD-JOB1&samplers=testSmallMutations_adding_40_users_30_groups&selectFields=samplers&checkBoxFields=includeTotal&metrics=AVERAGE_VALUE&selectFields=metrics&save=Submit . Select a good representative indicator.
fields.summary: Show performance graph on the team build screen

fields.description:
We should be able to just reuse most of http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Performance+Tuning

1. Copy the content from there to under Crowd tree
2. Edit it
fields.summary: Crowd performance tuning guide
Update the default connection pool size for different database implementations to more realistic value

fields.description:
'Lower Case Output' needs to be selected by default when integrating with JIRA.


- JIRA expects users names to be created in lower cases. 
- It does not allow mixed or upper case username to be created from UI.
- It may causes obscure behaviour of the application as JIRA is developed to support only lower cases.
for eg. If a case sensitive db locale is used JIRA, a user may finish with two 'identical' usernames, when restoring backup to case insensitive db locale.
fields.summary: 'Lower Case Output' needs to be selected by default when integrating with JIRA

fields.description: Since Crowd 2.1, we've had the ability to retrieve the SSO cookie name using the CrowdClient - we should do it. The cookie name should be overridable from the {{crowd.properties}} file.
fields.summary: CrowdHttpAuthenticatorImpl should use the CrowdClient to determine the SSO cookie name
Clean up DirectoryInstanceLoaders

fields.description:
We need to verify that this does not occur in Hibernate 3: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/EMBCWD-806

Easy way to test: execute an active/inactive query via the user search and see if it works/breaks in Postgres.
fields.summary: Verify EMBCWD-806 doesn't affect our Hibernate 3 DAO implementations

fields.description: release:prepare target updates pom file versions and scm information, and tries to build the project before committing the changes. Source distribution currently fails, as it tries to fetch sources for the yet unreleased version of Crowd.
fields.summary: Crowd source distribution fails when doing release:perform

fields.description:
Currently deactivated users can still reset their password. They are not told that their account is deactivated.
Thus they often reset their password several times and wonder why this stupid system doesn't allow them to login.
It would be nice if the password reset mail would tell them that the account is deactivated.
fields.summary: Tell deactivated users who reset their password that they are deactivated

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 18 October 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hello everyone,

We are pleased to announce that we have released Crowd 3.3 which includes Delegated Group Level Admin in Crowd.

You can download Crowd 3.3 from here: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/download/data-center]

Here you can find the release notes: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/crowd-3-3-release-notes-958762272.html]

Please note that in order to use Delegated Group Level Admin in Crowd you will need Crowd Data Center license.

You can create your evaluation license for Crowd Data Center here [https://my.atlassian.com/license/evaluation]

If you need any assistance with the Crowd Data Center installation you can follow our Getting started guide [https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/installing-crowd-data-center-935369773.html]

We hope that you will enjoy this version as much as we do!

Please reply directly to my email to share your feedback or just add your comments in this ticket. We'd love to hear your thoughts!

Best regards,

Marek Radochonski
 Senior Product Manager, Crowd
 [mradochonski@atlassian.com|mailto:mradochonski@atlassian.com]
{panel}
A customer pointed out that it will be cool to have a group (or groups) level admin permission.

This permission will allow them to control who can be a member of their group(s) and grant appropriate permissions to them.

This way those group owners would have control over adding/removing users from their group without having to be a JIRA/Confluence/Crowd admin. This would be similar to how JIRA allows project admins to place users into roles for their project. The control would be with the individuals that maintain the groups, not Crowd admins.
fields.summary: Group level admin permission

fields.description: OperationNotSupportedException will subclass OperationFailedException (i.e. it's a checked exception). Convert all instances of implementations which previously threw an UnsupportedOperationException with the new OperationNotSupportedException.
fields.summary: Throw an OperationNotSupportedException in RemoteDirectory implementations

fields.description:
DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory.updateUserCredential allows the update of the internal user's password.

This update has no effect because the user's credentials cannot be updated on the directory. This should throw an OperationFailedException("Passwords are stored in LDAP and are read-only for delegated authentication directory").
fields.summary: DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory should not allow update a user's credential

fields.description:
When Crowd is installed, by default Applications > Crowd > Remote Addresses lists out the following:
 - Current network IPv6 address
 - Current network IPv4 address (Mine was 172.20.7.230 at time of installation)

We ensure that the following are also on the list:
 - localhost
 - 127.0.0.1
 - <machine-name>.local

However, Crowd will not let you login if your IP address changes, as it will think that you are attempting to connect from your network port's IP address without considering localhost or 127.0.0.1. It will display the error message: "Login Invalid". 

The following messages were shown in the log file. 
{code}
2011-02-23 15:23:54,729 http-8095-5 INFO [crowd.manager.validation.ClientValidationManagerImpl] Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.
2011-02-23 15:23:54,770 http-8095-3 INFO [service.soap.client.SecurityServerClientImpl] Existing application token is null, authenticating
...
2011-02-23 15:23:54,848 http-8095-5 INFO [crowd.manager.validation.ClientValidationManagerImpl] Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.
2011-02-23 15:23:54,854 http-8095-3 ERROR [crowd.integration.springsecurity.CrowdSSOAuthenticationProcessingFilter] Unable to unset Crowd SSO token com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidAuthorizationTokenException: Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.
...
Caused by: org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.
...
2011-02-23 15:23:54,898 http-8095-3 ERROR [crowd.console.action.Login] Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.; nested exception is com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidAuthorizationTokenException: Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.
org.springframework.security.AuthenticationServiceException: Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.; nested exception is com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidAuthorizationTokenException: Client with address "172.20.5.73", and hostname "172.20.5.73" is forbidden from making requests to the application, crowd.
...etc
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot login to Crowd when IP address is changed

fields.description:
JIRA expects users to be created in lower cases; Therefore the below doco pages:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+JIRA
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Enforcing+Lower-Case+Usernames,+Groups+and+Roles+for+an+Application

must mention this configuration step/ requirement.
fields.summary: Enforcing Lower-Case must be mentioned in 'IntegratingCrowd with Atlassian JIRA'

fields.description:
Following on from the issue where Japanese, Chinese, etc names are displayed incorrectly because Crowd sets a user's default display name as $FirstName $LastName, whereas some languages require the format to be $LastName $FirstName. 

Allowing a user's display name to be edited will allow the format to be set however a user decides. However this will only fix crowd and still means that users created in Confluence and JIRA will face the same problem.
fields.summary: Allow user display name to be edited

fields.description:
Some examples include throwing IllegalArgumentExceptions and UnsupportedOperationExceptions

Instead we should prefer throwing checked exceptions such as InvalidUser/InvalidGroup and ReadOnlyGroupException/OperationFailedException. The message of the method should be used to explain the underlying specific cause of the error as it is likely to get logged.

Runtime exceptions cause the entire ASG iteration over directories to fail-fast and, in most cases, bubble straight up to the UI and smacks the user with a 500 page.
fields.summary: Crowd RemoteDirectory implementations should not throw RuntimeExceptions unless there is a catastrophic, system-wide, non-recoverable error

fields.description: We don't have REST calls to see if the SSO cookie has expired - the user has to login and this will throw an error, then the user has to re-authenticate.
fields.summary: Add REST API to check if SSO Cookie has expired

fields.description: We don't have REST calls to see if the SSO cookie has expired - the user has to login and this will throw an error, then the user has to re-authenticate.
fields.summary: Add REST API to check if SSO Cookie has expired

fields.description:
Currently the membership sync logging is way too verbose in JIRA and Confluence. It logs once per group whose memberships are migrated.

Ideal would be if we could change this to log just five or ten times for the entirety of the membership sync. If we know the count of the total groups we should be able to do so quite easily.

{noformat}
2011-02-24 16:02:16,431 INFO [QuartzScheduler_Worker-8] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectoryCache] syncUserMembershipsForGroup scanned and compared [ 1 ] user members from [ group-1237 ] in [ 4ms ]
2011-02-24 16:02:16,436 INFO [QuartzScheduler_Worker-8] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectoryCache] syncGroupMembershipsForGroup scanned and compared [ 1 ] group members from [ group-1237 ] in [ 4ms ]
2011-02-24 16:02:16,436 INFO [QuartzScheduler_Worker-8] [directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher] synchroniseMembershipsForGroup found [ 1 ] remote user-group memberships in [ 0ms ]
2011-02-24 16:02:16,436 INFO [QuartzScheduler_Worker-8] [directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher] synchroniseMembershipsForGroup found [ 1 ] remote group-group memberships in [ 0ms ]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Logging for membership sync is too verbose

fields.description: When integrating Crowd with Google Apps via Google's Directory Sync application, users are synchronized via their email addresses.  If a user changes their email address to an address in a domain which the Google Apps account cannot access, the sync tool will remove that user from the Google Apps account at which point they have effectively deleted themselves from the system.  In this scenario, their email address is effectively acting as a username and should be immutable.
fields.summary: Administrators should be able to prevent users from changing their own names and passwords

fields.description:
We need to create a Crowd 2.2.1 branch specific for Confluence.

We will make this branch on Monday, and release 2.2.1-rc1 off the branch. We will also need to release EMBCWD 1.1-rc1, but we can do this off EMBCWD trunk as we do not plan on making any changes to trunk post-RC unless it's specifically required for Confluence.

Confluence will be building their RC on Tuesday.

Trunk will need to be versioned to 2.2.2-SNAPSHOT.

Send out an email to the embedded list so that everyone is aware that only bug fixes affecting Confluence specifically are to go into the branch (and must be merged back into trunk). Work on Crowd specific bugs ("squash list") is only to occur on trunk.
fields.summary: Branch Crowd 2.2.1 and release RC1

fields.description:
When there are two Delegated Directories assigned to an application and a user trying to authenticate is found in the *second* one only, the authentication is successful, however the user is added to the *first* Directory.

After the user is added to the wrong directory, the authentication may or may not work (both behaviors were observed).
fields.summary: User is added to the wrong Delegated Directory

fields.description:
Currently you can only add regex constraints for passwords to Crowd's internal directories.  It would be useful for Crowd to have the options to configure validation of a password against regex parameters.  For example, validating one or more of the following:

* # of characters in password
* Are numbers required
* Are capital letters required
* Are symbols required
fields.summary: Allow Regex constraints for LDAP or AD passwords

fields.description:
It would be good if we could update the Dragons documentation in Stage 8 Step 4/12. There is a slight changes in the authenticator as mentioned in the following documentation:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+Bamboo#IntegratingCrowdwithAtlassianBamboo-2.5%28Optional%29EnableSingleSignOn

The outdated dragon slayer documentation:
*  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Dragons+Stage+8+-+Install+Bamboo#DragonsStage8-InstallBamboo-Step4.HookBamboouptoCrowd
fields.summary: Update dragon slayer documentation

fields.description:
Currently, our [REST Docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWDDEV/Crowd+REST+Resources] provide examples in XML only.

To avoid confusion when developers try to use JSON, we need to provide the equivalent JSON examples as well.
fields.summary: Provide JSON Request and Response examples for the Server REST APIs

fields.description:
Crowd's password encoders should be marked as system plugins so that they appear as such in Confluence/JIRA.

Crowd does not bundle the UPM, so this issue isn't as prevalent in Crowd, but embedded Crowd apps will display the encoders as a user "installed plugin". Disabling the password encoders plugin will mean that users will be unable to authenticate into the app, which is a serious consequence.

This should fix: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-2434
fields.summary: Crowd's password encoder plugins should be marked as system plugins

fields.description: Issuing "stop_crowd" command does not always shutdown crowd standalone. This occurs even before the tomcat upgrade.
fields.summary: Standalone crowd fails to shutdown

fields.description:
After upgrading to the latest version of ehcache, ensure that the "phone-home" feature is disabled.

Ehcache 1.7.0+ will periodically phone home and emit a log message if there is a newer version available. This isn't a useful check when ehcache is shipped as a library in another product.
fields.summary: Upgrade ehcache and disable phone-home timers

fields.description:
If the user or group does not exist, the remove method should return silently.

For individual remove operations, a boolean should be returned to indicate whether a removal operation occurred.

This affects RemoteDirectory, UserDao, GroupDao, InternalRemoteDirectory

Consider doing the same for membership removal operations as well (e.g. {{RemoteDirectory#removeGroupFromGroup}} should not throw {{MembershipNotFoundException}}, etc).
fields.summary: Remove entity operations should not throw a *NotFoundException

fields.description:
The Bamboo Jmeter Plugin can interpret CSV data: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JMETAGG/Bamboo+JMeter+Aggregator+Plugin

If we spit out a one-line CSV that has of the form: 10k load gen, 2k ou swap, 1k to 10k, etc

then we will be able to aggregate statistics over builds, so that we can visualise any performance regressions.

If we have issues with this, the best person to ask for help is James Roper.
fields.summary: Update our TPM load build to spit out CSV data consumable by the Bamboo JMeter plugin

fields.description: Currently, the .sh and .bat scripts that start Crowd define {{-XX:MaxPermSize=256m}}, however, when installing Crowd as a Windows Service, the property value is not defined.
fields.summary: Add the -XX:MaxPermSize definition to the Windows Service installer

fields.description:
Release the final version of Crowd 2.2.0 and EMBCWD 1.0 for JIRA's 4.3 build.

Verify that there have been no source code changes in either project since RC2 before releasing.
fields.summary: Release Crowd 2.2.0 final and EMBCWD 1.0 final
Export fails if the user doesn't contain a password
Please update the help-paths.properties file for Crowd 2.2

fields.description: In order for Confluence to connect to Crowd for SSO, users must have configured a Crowd directory in the Admin UI plugin with their application username and password, but then also have set the same username and password in a crowd.properties inside the confluence install. This is defective and unnecessarily confusing, as users should never have to configure the crowd.properties in a SSO install.
fields.summary: SSO configuration requires application user/pass in two locations
CrowdDirectoryServiceImpl tries to change attributes of ImmutableApplication

fields.description:
Method *getLoginCookieKey* (DefaultAuthenticator), exists in Seraph 2.1.4 but was removed from 2.4 (Bamboo 3.0).

Class *CrowdAuthenticator* extends *DefaultAuthenticator* and uses getLoginCookieKey.

Tested with Bamboo 3.0 and Crowd 2.1.1
{noformat}
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.seraph.CrowdAuthenticator.getLoginCookieKey()Ljava/lang/String;
at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.seraph.CrowdAuthenticator.autoLoginToCrowd(CrowdAuthenticator.java:252)
at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.seraph.CrowdAuthenticator.isAuthenticated(CrowdAuthenticator.java:193)
at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.seraph.CrowdAuthenticator.getUser(CrowdAuthenticator.java:307)
at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:129)
at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1322)
at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.BaseLoginFilter.doFilter(BaseLoginFilter.java:144)
at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1322)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter$1.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:66)

at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:74)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:42)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:77)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:63)
at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1322)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:77)
at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:63)
at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1322)

Workaround: To continue using the Bamboo Original Authenticator, instead of the Crowd Authenticator
{code}
<controller class="com.atlassian.bamboo.user.authentication.BambooSecurityController"/>
{code}
Authentication against Crowd will continue working. SSO will not work until this problem is fixed.
fields.summary: Seraph 2.4 breaks the CrowdAuthenticator for Bamboo

fields.description:
# User enters http://server/openidserver/
# User selects "Can't access your account?" 
# User selects "I have forgotten my password"
# User enters username
# User gets email with activation url and clicks it
# User user changes password and is presented with a login screen
# *User tries to login with the new password on that screen but this fails.*
# If the user goes back to http://server/openidserver/ the user can login with the new password
# if the user goes to another Crowd-integrated app like confluence, the new password works there as well.

The login prompt shown when the system fails is not the same login prompt as shown at the first page (http://server/openidserver/)
fields.summary: After changing password using the password reminder, not possible to login using the prompt which is shown directly afterwards.
RemoteCrowdDirectory and ApplicationService throw InvalidAuthenticationException instead of UserNotFoundException when user cannot be found

fields.description:
This could result in unique key violations in the DB

Perhaps we could find all the memberships of the user and actually work out what we need to add them to
fields.summary: DbCachingRemoteDirectory.authenticateAndEnsureInternalUserExists clones the group memberships but does not check if the user is already a member

fields.description: We should catch the exception and do nothing as this can occur if another thread was attempting the same action - we should instead find the already created user and return them - if that fails then just throw invalid auth with a msg explaining what happened.
fields.summary: DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory throws OperationFailedException if a user already exists when attempting to be cloned
Change AutoGroupAdderListener to listen to the new event
Fire event on successful authentication
Update UI to explain the new behaviour

fields.description: Currently only new users are added to auto add groups. This must be changed so that we add users to auto add groups on successful authentication.
fields.summary: Automatic group adding should be performed on successful authentication instead of user creation

fields.description: See CONFDEV-2987
fields.summary: CachedCrowdGroupDao does not cache locally added groups in Confluence

fields.description:
Authentication should skip over failing directory in ApplicationServiceGeneric.authenticateUser().

This means:
- we should catch (swallow) OperationFailedException, log it as an error
- if we do run into an OperationFailedException AND the user is not authenticated successfully in any other directory, then we throw the first OperationFailedException we run into
-- this will also require changes to the catch block of InvalidAuthenticationException, ie. we need to unit test this one pretty thoroughly
- if possible, we should write an integration test for this behaviour
- we should update the javadoc
fields.summary: Authentication should skip over failing directory in ASG

fields.description:
Currently, Crowd has an Apache/SVN connector.

Would be good to have a Mercurial Connector that would provide the fine-grained security features currently available to the SVN integration.
fields.summary: Support Mercurial Authentication

fields.description: The Ldap and LdapDelegating classes share the properties for an LDAP directory but are not related by class. A common superclass (LdapCommonAttributes?) could take the common code and properties without requiring one to be a subclass of the other.
fields.summary: Share code and behaviour between Ldap and LdapDelegating directory attributes

fields.description:
The ImmutableApplication contains mutable objects, and some of these may be Hibernate lazy loading proxy instances instead of fully initialised model objects. Failing to do this can leave users of this class open to LazyInitializationExceptions if they use it for caching.

The Builder should instead copy construct each of the directoyMappings and remoteAddresses properties, and force these to also create new ImmutableDirectory (etc) instances as they copy.
fields.summary: ImmutableApplication Builder does not do deep copy, contains lazy Directory proxies

fields.description: When creating a new user, if the directory drop down menu is left blank then the validation error appears twice.
fields.summary: Invalid Directory validation appears twice when adding a user with no directory selected

fields.description:
LDAP "test connection" button currently:
- checks the LDAP host exists
- checks that authentication works with the supplied connection user DN / password

It would be nice if it:
- verified the existence of the base DN
- verified the existence of the user DN
- verified the existence of the group DN

It would be even nicer if it:
- verified each of the user attribute mappings
- verified each of the group attribute mappings
fields.summary: LDAP "test connection" button should check DN additions

fields.description: Announce discontinuation of JDK 5 support for Crowd 2.3.
fields.summary: Announce discontinuation of JDK 5 support

fields.description:
We need a notice in the Role Browser to state that:

"Roles have been deprecated since Crowd 2.0 and they will be removed entirely in Crowd 2.3. Please migrate your roles to groups."
fields.summary: Deprecate roles in the Role Browser UI

fields.description:
The Crowd build should move to 1.6 and remove support for 1.5. Deployment will require a 1.6 JDK and any consumers of Crowd modules will also need to have upgraded to 1.6.

Customers will need to be notified.

Adjust the Enforcer rules and build.compiler.target to record the fact.
fields.summary: Require JDK 1.6

fields.description: Any modules that are consumed by other products should log with slf4j to avoid imposing a logging framework.
fields.summary: Migrate logging to slf4j

fields.description: We will only import nested group if source and destination both support, otherwise a warning message will be shown.
fields.summary: Import functionality does not take into account nested groups.

fields.description: Currently, the maximum number of users that can be listed is 100. It would be nice to have a drop down option for 1,000 and 10,000 users.
fields.summary: Increase the maximum number of results when searching for users to add

fields.description:
Currently the administrator is not able to know who changed or when the user password was changed or if a change was requested.

Adding log messages to MailManagerImpl and ResetPassword would allow this.
fields.summary: Add log messages to class MailManagerImpl

fields.description: We are on 1.9
fields.summary: Upgrade to Atlassian XWork 1.11

fields.description:
Upgrade to Seraph 2.4, if required for Confluence/Bamboo.

Note: it is not required for JIRA as of JIRA 4.3 as they own their Crowd SSO authenticator.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Seraph 2.5

	at com.atlassian.crowd.console.action.directory.UpdateConnectorConnection.execute(UpdateConnectorConnection.java:89)
	... 126 more{code}


h2. Cause

You use {{TimeUnit.MINUTES}} in {{UpdateConnectorConnection.java}}. This {{enum}} was initially added to jdk 6.  I use jdk 1.5 (one of two supported jdk versions).
fields.summary: Get InvocationTargetException by click on LDAP connector tab

fields.description: Please, see cases detailed at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CWDSUP-4394
fields.summary: Document Real World cases of Alias usage and Potential Risks

fields.description: Allow to 'bulk' add an attribute for all users in a Crowd directory.
fields.summary: Adding a user attribute for all users in a directory

fields.description:
Crowd will fail to export if an LDAP user doesn't have an email:
{code}
Cause :
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Adding text to an XML document must not be null
Stack Trace :
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Adding text to an XML document must not be null
at org.dom4j.DocumentFactory.createText(DocumentFactory.java:142)
at org.dom4j.tree.AbstractElement.addText(AbstractElement.java:1286)
at com.atlassian.crowd.migration.UserMapper.addUserToXml(UserMapper.java:86)
{code}
fields.summary: Export fails if an LDAP user doesn't have an email address defined

fields.description: Add focus.onload in the Login screen's Username field, to speed up logging in.
fields.summary: Add focus.onload in the Login screen's Username field

fields.description:
- Notes: [https://confxhtml.atlassian.com/display/QA/Crowd+2.2+M7+Release+Test+(Fede+-+02.07.2011)]

My recommendation is to check behavior when running on 32-bit JDK and Tomcat, and if that works notify documentation team to reinforce the fact that 64-bit JDK/Tomcat is not supported.
fields.summary: Investigate memory spike and lack of response when syncing and running as a Windows Service

fields.description: Originally raised as https://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-4677
fields.summary: ClassCastException when performing REST authentication against LDAP

fields.description:
Release 2.2-rc1 so that JIRA can test with it. Also release relevant rc1 of EMBCWD.

Once released, organised EAC/C dogfood of 2.2-rc1
fields.summary: Release Crowd 2.2-rc1

fields.description:
Seen in 2.2.0-m6

Probably because JIRA is using the {{NoopClientProperties}}
fields.summary: The way the crowd-integration-client is configured in JIRA means that it cannot see the crowd.property.http.proxy.host/crowd.property.http.proxy.port proeprties

fields.description:
Crowd will not accept an email such as 'TEST@example.com' as valid, although it will accept 'TESt@example.com'.

From my quick reading of [RFC2822|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2822] (particularly sections 3.2.4 and 3.4.1) it seems this should be allowed.
fields.summary: Crowd email validation regex does not accept addresses with a capital letter before the @ symbol

fields.description:
Scenario: JIRA -> Crowd -> LDAP Delegated Auth

# New user is created in LDAP.
# New user tries to log in in JIRA.

-> Authentication succeeds, and the new user is created in Crowd, but will not be visible in JIRA before the next synchronisation with Crowd.

The specific problem is that DBCachingRemoteDirectory#authenticate does not create non-existing users in the local directory.

Ideally we would do full synchronisation in this case, but a full synchronisation can take a very long time. Creating user in the local directory and adding group memberships for the user should fix this situation.
fields.summary: User should exist in the local directory after successful authentication

fields.description:
- Login to crowd as an administrator and click to add a new directory
- On the first tabs (Details), type a directory name and click "Next"

*Expected*: The Connector tab to load with no errors

*Actual*:The Connector tab loads with errors:
fields.summary: Error message is displayed before submitting connector details when adding a new directory

fields.description: Crowd contains a number of references to InetAddress.getLocalhost() and the loopback addresses 127.0.0.1 and ::1. These should be unified through a stubbable MachineAddresses interface so the behaviour is centralised and consistent.
fields.summary: Unify references to localhost

fields.description:
The current version filter uses the application's version number as the value to set in the HTTP response header. However, with the Crowd REST service being used in both JIRA and Crowd, this version number becomes meaningless with JIRA on version 4.3 and Crowd on version 2.1/2.2.

The fix should be to include the product name in the X-Embedded-Crowd-Version header, and add an extra header indicating the version number of the REST service API.
fields.summary: Add better version information to Crowd's REST services

fields.description:
It looks trivial but if these classes are persisted on disk, it would be difficult trying to upgrade them later.
Not sure if we do persist them as serialized form in crowd though.
fields.summary: Not all serializable classes have versionId declared

fields.description:
There are two bugs with the implementation of ImmutableApplication.getDirectoryMapping(long):

* it throws NoSuchElementException when no mapping exists, instead of returning null
* it doesn't match against the provided directoryId parameter -- the argument isn't used in the method body.

We currently have a copy of ImmutableApplication in Confluence with these issues fixed so our caching works correctly. I'd like to get rid of it, so if Crowd 2.2 contains this fix that would be super.
fields.summary: ImmutableApplication.getDirectoryMapping(long) does not work correctly

fields.description: This is reproducible in JIRA and Confluence. In Crowd: Add an LDAP server to Crowd In Crowd: Allow access to JIRA application exposing the LDAP directory In Crowd: In the Permissions tab, uncheck the "Add Groups" permission. In Jira: Add Crowd Server as a user directory (put it at the top and synchronize) In Jira: Go to the Group Browser and try to add a group Expected: Either the "Add Group" to be disabled, or an error message saying that it could not add group due to lack of permissions. Depending on the design, it is also possible for the group creation to fall back to the internal directory. Actual: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Application "jira" does not allow adding of groups. Note 1: Similar errors occur in Jira and Confluence for the following actions (if they are disabled in Crowd): "Add Users", "Add Groups", "Modify Users", "Modify Groups". Note 2: Notice that for Jira "Remove User" and "Remove Group" display error messages as expected, while Confluence these actions also throw similar errors as above.
fields.summary: Unhandled exception when trying to add group and Crowd Server does not have the "Add Group" permission

fields.description:
- Add a Read-Write LDAP directory to Jira with one user that has sn="User from LDAP"
- Synchronize, you will see the user appear
- Go to "User Browser" select the user from LDAP, notice that full name = "User from LDAP"
- Click on Edit Details, don't change anything and click save.

*Expected*: User to maintain its full name = "User from LDAP"
	
*Actual*: Full name was changed to = "from LDAP"
	
*Notes*:
- if I perform the operation again, the full name will keep loosing its first word until it keeps only the last word.
- From http://docs.atlassian.com/crowd/latest/com/atlassian/crowd/util/UserUtils.html#populateNames%28com.atlassian.crowd.model.user.User%29 , the expectation is for Crowd to create the "displayName" and "givenName" based on the information provided. In this case, the expected values are givenName="User", sn="from LDAP", displayName="User from LDAP".
fields.summary: If LDAP entry only has "sn" attribute, the first word gets cut when updating user from Jira (loss of information)

fields.description:
For the following directories the "User Name RDN Attribute" is set to "null" by default. This should be empty string (to match embedded crowd) and the field should not be marked as required.

- Apple Open Directory (Read-Only)
- FedoraDS (Read-Only Posix Schema)
- OpenLDAP (Read-Only Posix Schema)
- Generic Posix/RFC2307 Directory (Read-Only)
fields.summary: "User Name RDN Attribute" is set to "null" for some directories

fields.description:
Note: I am assuming a Crowd issue since that's the top of the stack, however, the error was found while interacting with Confluence.

• In Crowd: Add an ActiveDirectory LDAP server to Crowd (no SSL).
• In Crowd: Add Confluence application and map it to the new AD.
• In Confluence: Add the Crowd Server as the user directory, set it to read-write and add it to the top of the list.
• In Confluence: Try to add a new user

*Expected*: An error message that states that Crowd Server could not perform this operation. My understanding is that adding users to AD is only allowed through SSL connection, which is why this would fail.
	
*Actual*: Unhandled exception: 
	javax.xml.bind.DataBindingException: javax.xml.bind.UnmarshalException - with linked exception: [org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x0) was found in the element content of the document.]
	    at javax.xml.bind.JAXB.unmarshal(JAXB.java:201)


Note: Same thing happens when trying to "Change Password" for an AD user from Confluence.
fields.summary: Unhandled exception when adding user when linked to a Crowd Server that is set as Read-Write but the directory does not have write permissions.

fields.description:
User Passwords are sent across as plain text in SOAP/Rest requests when integrated with Bamboo/Confluence and etc.

If you set the Crowd logging to DEBUG the passwords are logged in the Crowd logs:

{code}
2011-01-28 14:17:06,376 http-8080-Processor24 DEBUG [service.soap.xfire.XFireInLoggingMethodHandler] SOAP service method: authenticatePrincipal
	com.atlassian.crowd.integration.authentication.AuthenticatedToken@21914d3d[name=bamboo,token=bpBeMBh2BEAuFWl7Y79o9A00]
	com.atlassian.crowd.integration.authentication.UserAuthenticationContext@4a65f102[name=admin,credential=com.atlassian.crowd.integration.authentication.PasswordCredential@6ab1e076[credential=adminpassword,encryptedCredential=false],validationFactors={},application=bamboo]

{code}
fields.summary: User Passwords are logged when Crowd logging is set to DEBUG

fields.description:
See: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CWDSUP-4148 (which i do not have direct access to)

I think there is some confusion somewhere.  We use the crowd-integration-client-2.0.7.jar which has authentication cacheing (if I remember correctly, this was a change in this version)

We were told the jira and confluence crowd connectors cannot be configured with authentication.


Can you either clarify this issue for me, or add support for authorization caching, our jira instance hits our Crowd server WAY to much.
fields.summary: Enable authentication Cacheing

fields.description:
When an account in Crowd is locked (because it reached the maximum number of attempts), Crowd should send an email to the account owner explaining why he is not able to login and making suggestion on how to fix the problem (contact admin)

This does not include the "password expired" use case, as the Crowd Web Console in this situation would just request for a new password. However, this is not done when JIRA or other integrated application is being used. Therefore, if the password expired and an App is being used, the email would also be necessary.
fields.summary: Improve Communication when account in Crowd is locked

fields.description: When adding a new user many error get captured and re-thrown as an InvalidUserException.  This makes it difficult (in JIRA) to correctly handle the error that is being returned.
fields.summary: Crowd's SpringLDAPConnector mutates any generic error (NamingException) to a InvalidUserException which is just wrong and unexpected.

fields.description:
Note: I would like to bring this to the attention of the doc team. I was confused for a while and thinking that we had a security bug in our hands. Turns out this is a known issue with AD, and there are ways to mitigate how long the old password remains active for: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/906305 

- Add an ActiveDirectory in Crowd with Read-Write permissions. I used ldaps://crowd-ad1.sydney.atlassian.com:636 (make sure to install the certificate as mentioned here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/LDAP+Servers
- Add the directory to an application and set allow all to authenticate = true.
- Verify that you can authenticate with the AD user by going to the Authentication Test
- Go to the Users tab and select the AD user.
- Change the users password
- Go back to the Authentication Test

*Expected*: User to only be able to authenticate with the new password

*Actual*: User can authenticate with the new password as well as the old one.
fields.summary: Document: User from ActiveDirectory can authenticate with previous password after changing password through Crowd.

fields.description:
Attempting to add a user to a group before the groups have been sync'ed from the remote directory results in the following stack trace:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Group already exists
at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdAdminServiceImpl.addUserToGroup(CrowdAdminServiceImpl.java:396)
at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.doAddUserToGroup(UserUtilImpl.java:501)
at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.addUserToGroup(UserUtilImpl.java:479)
at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.addUserToGroups(UserUtilImpl.java:516)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.group.DefaultGroupService.addUsersToGroups(DefaultGroupService.java:331)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.EditUserGroups.doExecute(EditUserGroups.java:85)
at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:58)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:139)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:168)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a read/write LDAP Directory in Jira.
* Browse for a user that exists in LDAP (using the User Browser).
* Select "Groups" link to edit groups
* Select the "jira-users" from the list and click "Join"

Expected:
* User successfully added to "jira-users"
fields.summary: Problem adding group membership before directory sync

fields.description:
crowd-web-app assumes crowd-bundled-plugins has already run.

crowd-bundled-plugins' generate-resources phase copies files into crowd-web-app's src directory. This defeats 'clean' and means a build that omits this module will generate a broken webapp.

crowd-web-app should depend on, and copy over, any resources it needs.
fields.summary: Crowd build relies on crowd-bundled-plugins modifying crowd-web-app's src directory
